content.description:
“We...sent to your Royal Highness a letter.... In it we recounted the great victory which Our Lord had granted us. We explained that our kingdom was already Christian and we asked your Royal Highness to send us several clerics or brothers to teach us and to help us spread the faith. We also sent...our son and...our nephew, so that your Royal Highness may have them educated....”
Source: Letter from Nzinga Mbemba (Afonso I), King of Kongo, to Manuel I, King of Portugal, 1514
content.question: Which of the following best describes the purpose of King Nzinga Mbemba’s letter?

choices.label: To express the concern that missionaries sent by the Portuguese ruler are causing problems
To declare that Kongo does not want the Portuguese people taking resources from their country
To establish the Christian identity of Kongo and ask for help from the Portuguese ruler
To mandate that the Portuguese people may not claim the land of the Kingdom of Kongo

content.answer: To establish the Christian identity of Kongo and ask for help from the Portuguese ruler
